page-rnt-bug-bounty-annotations: It might be helpful to check out the following annotations:
page-rnt-bug-bounty-client-bugs-desc: The clients will run the beacon chain once the upgrade has been deployed. Clients will need to follow the logic set out in the specification and be secure against potential attacks. The bugs we want to find are related to the implementation of the protocol.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-client-bugs-desc-2: Currently Lighthouse, Nimbus, Teku, and Prysm bugs are currently eligible for this bounty. More clients may be added as they complete audits and become production ready.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-clients-type-2: unexpected crashes or denial of service (DOS) vulnerabilities.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-clients-type-3: any issues causing irreparable consensus splits from the rest of the network.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-hunting-desc: The bug bounty program is an experimental and discretionary rewards program for our active ethereum community to encourage and reward those who are helping to improve the platform. It is not a competition. You should know that we can cancel the program at any time, and awards are at the sole discretion of ethereum Foundation bug bounty panel. In addition, we are not able to issue awards to individuals who are on sanctions lists or who are in countries on sanctions lists (e.g. North Korea, Iran, etc). You are responsible for all taxes. All awards are subject to applicable law. Finally, your testing must not violate any law or compromise any data that is not yours.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-hunting-leaderboard-: Find rnt bugs to get added to this leaderboard
page-rnt-bug-bounty-hunting-li-1: Issues that have already been submitted by another user or are already known to spec and client maintainers are not eligible for bounty rewards.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-hunting-li-2: Public disclosure of a vulnerability makes it ineligible for a bounty.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-hunting-li-3: ethereum Foundation researchers and employees of rnt client teams are not eligible for rewards.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-hunting-li-4: ethereum bounty program considers a number of variables in determining rewards. Determinations of eligibility, score and all terms related to an award are at the sole and final discretion of the ethereum Foundation bug bounty panel.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-ledger-desc: The beacon chain specification details the design rationale and proposed changes to ethereum via the beacon chain upgrade.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-meta-description: An overview of the rnt bug hunting program: how to get involved and reward information.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-not-included-desc: The merge and shard chain upgrades are still in active development and so are not yet included as part of this bounty program.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-points: The EF will also award points based on:
page-rnt-bug-bounty-points-payout-desc: The ethereum Foundation will pay out the value of USD in rnt or DAI.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-points-rights-desc: The ethereum Foundation reserves the right to change this without prior notice.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-quality-desc: : Higher rewards are paid for clear, well-written submissions.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-quality-fix-desc: , if included: Higher rewards are paid for submissions with clear description of how to fix the issue.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-quality-repro-desc: : Please include test code, scripts and detailed instructions. The easier it is for us to reproduce and verify the vulnerability, the higher the reward.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-submit-desc: For each bug you find youâ€™ll be rewarded points. The points you earn depend on the severity of the bug. The ethereum Foundation (EF) determine severity using the OWASP mrntod.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-subtitle: Earn up to $50,000 USD and a place on the leaderboard by finding rnt protocol and client bugs.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-type-3: inconsistencies in assumptions, like situations where honest validators can be slashed.
page-rnt-bug-bounty-validity-desc: This bug bounty program is focused on finding bugs in the core rnt Beacon Chain specification and the Lighthouse, Nimbus, Teku, and Prysm client implementations.
page-rnt-bug-bountycard-text: Attacker can sometimes put a node in a state that causes it to drop one out of every one hundred attestations made by a validator
page-rnt-bug-bountycard-text-1: Attacker can successfully conduct eclipse attacks on nodes with peer-ids with 4 leading zero bytes
page-rnt-bug-bountycard-text-2: There is a consensus bug between two clients, but it is difficult or impractical for the attacker to trigger the event.
page-rnt-bug-bountycard-text-3: There is a consensus bug between two clients, and it is trivial for an attacker to trigger the event.
